title: Debiasing, calibrating, and improving Semi-supervised Learning performance via simple Ensemble Projector. (arXiv:2310.15764v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Recent studies on semi-supervised learning (SSL) have achieved great success. Despite their promising performance, current state-of-the-art methods tend toward increasingly complex designs at the cost of introducing more network components and additional training procedures. In this paper, we propose a simple method named Ensemble Projectors Aided for Semi-supervised Learning (EPASS), which focuses mainly on improving the learned embeddings to boost the performance of the existing contrastive joint-training semi-supervised learning frameworks. Unlike standard methods, where the learned embeddings from one projector are stored in memory banks to be used with contrastive learning, EPASS stores the ensemble embeddings from multiple projectors in memory banks. As a result, EPASS improves generalization, strengthens feature representation, and boosts performance. translated_title: 通过简单的集成投影器消除偏见、校准和改进半监督学习性能
translated_abstract: 最近关于半监督学习（SSL）的研究取得了很大的成功。尽管现有的最新方法在性能上很有前景，但它们往往倾向于通过引入更多的网络组件和额外的训练过程来获得越来越复杂的设计。在本文中，我们提出了一种简单的方法，名为集成投影器辅助半监督学习（EPASS），主要关注于改进学习的嵌入以提高现有对比联合训练半监督学习框架的性能。与标准方法不同，EPASS将多个投影器的集合嵌入存储在存储器中，以供对比学习时使用。结果，EPASS改善了泛化能力，加强了特征表示，并提高了性能。例如，EPASS将半监督学习的强基线的top-1错误率提高了39.47\%/31.39\%/24.70\%。
tldr: 本研究提出了一种简单的方法，通过集成投影器在半监督学习中改进了嵌入，从而提高了性能。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a simple method called EPASS that enhances embeddings in semi-supervised learning by using ensemble projectors, leading to improved performance.
